neighbors.name: Milligan Energy Center LLC
neighbors.claims: Milligan Energy Center LLC is a project entity formed by Ørsted for a planned 315 MW solar farm with a 315 MW/1,260 MWh battery storage system in Eloy, Pinal County ([Milligan Energy Center](https://milliganenergycenter.com)). The project is described as a long-term asset intended to provide power to approximately 68,000 homes ([Milligan Energy Center](https://milliganenergycenter.com)). Ørsted projects that the facility will create upwards of 300 construction jobs and generate local tax revenue ([Milligan Energy Center](https://milliganenergycenter.com)). The Eloy City Council approved the project in a 5-2 vote, with representation from the Rose Law Group ([Rose Law Group Reporter](https://www.roselawgroup.com/milligan-energy-center-court-rich-rose-law-group-co-founder-and-director-of-the-firms-renewable-energy-utility-infrastructure-department-helps-secure-project-approval-in-eloy/)). Arizona Public Service (APS) has identified the need for a new 230 kV line and substation, referred to as the "Milligan" substation, to connect this project to the grid ([APS Ten-Year Plan](https://www.oasis.oati.com/woa/docs/AZPS/AZPSdocs/2025_APS_Ten-Year_Plan.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Backed by Ørsted (global energy firm); approved by City Council despite some dissenting votes; significant local infrastructure (substation) named after project.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Ørsted’s development manager directly; explore collaboration or land agreements that align their project with yours, highlighting mutual benefits and avoiding conflicts in grid interconnection

citations.claim: planned 315 MW solar farm with a 315 MW/1,260 MWh battery storage system in Eloy, Pinal County
citations.title: Milligan Energy Center Project Overview

citations.claim: create upwards of 300 construction jobs and generate local tax revenue
citations.title: Milligan Energy Center Project Overview

citations.title: Milligan Energy Center: Court Rich helps secure project approval in Eloy

citations.claim: Arizona Public Service (APS) has identified the need for a new 230 kV line and substation, referred to as the "Milligan" substation
citations.title: APS 2025-2034 Ten-Year Transmission System Plan

neighbors.name: Eloy 170 LLC
neighbors.claims: Eloy 170 LLC is an Arizona limited-liability company actively developing land in the Eloy area. The entity is pursuing a General Plan Amendment and rezoning for a project known as "Eloy Commons," which includes two sites: "Eloy Commons North" (33.86 acres) and "Eloy Commons South" (111.1 acres) located near Milligan Road and Sunshine Blvd ([AZBEX](https://azbex.com/planning-development/eloy-pz-hears-dual-requests-for-major-land-use-overhaul/)). The proposed development includes light industrial, commercial, and residential uses ([AZBEX](https://azbex.com/planning-development/eloy-pz-hears-dual-requests-for-major-land-use-overhaul/)). In June 2025, Eloy 170 LLC sold a parcel in this vicinity to Blue Beacon, Inc. (a truck wash operator), consistent with the area's industrial development focus ([ROX Commercial](https://roxcommercial.com/blog/tag/pinal-county/)). The project applicant listed for Eloy 170 LLC in city documents is LBG Development, LLC ([AZBEX](https://azbex.com/planning-development/eloy-pz-hears-dual-requests-for-major-land-use-overhaul/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Actively engaging with City Planning and Zoning for a major master-planned development (Eloy Commons) spanning over 140 acres.

approach_recommendations.engage: Contact the LLC’s representative or LBG Development, LLC; coordinate regarding utility easements and road infrastructure as they are actively entitling adjacent land for mixed-use and industrial development.

citations.claim: pursuing a General Plan Amendment and rezoning for a project known as "Eloy Commons," which includes two sites: "Eloy Commons North" (33.86 acres) and "Eloy Commons South" (111.1 acres)
citations.title: Eloy P&Z Hears Dual Requests for Major Land Use Overhaul

neighbors.name: Arizona Public Service Company
neighbors.claims: Arizona Public Service Company (APS) is the state’s largest electric utility and has acquired land in this vicinity for planned grid infrastructure, specifically the Sundance to Milligan 230 kV transmission line and the Milligan substation ([APS Ten-Year Plan](https://www.oasis.oati.com/woa/docs/AZPS/AZPSdocs/2025_APS_Ten-Year_Plan.pdf)). APS exerts a major economic impact as Arizona’s top taxpayer, contributing roughly $11.3 billion annually to the state’s economy ([Pinal Post](https://pinalpost.com/pinal-county-energy-crisis-forces-push-to-solar-gas-and-battery-projects/)). The utility has publicly emphasized the need for more solar farms and battery storage in Pinal County to meet a projected 40% surge in power demand over six years ([Pinal Post](https://pinalpost.com/pinal-county-energy-crisis-forces-push-to-solar-gas-and-battery-projects/)). APS’s expansion plans in Pinal, including the new 230 kV infrastructure, indicate it is actively facilitating renewable projects to improve grid reliability and capacity ([APS Ten-Year Plan](https://www.oasis.oati.com/woa/docs/AZPS/AZPSdocs/2025_APS_Ten-Year_Plan.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Largest electric utility in region; significant taxpayer and employer; deep political and regulatory influence on local development; critical infrastructure partner.

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with APS’s government affairs and transmission planning teams early; align the project’s benefits with APS’s grid needs and policy goals to secure their buy-in and support

citations.title: APS 2025-2034 Ten-Year Transmission System Plan
